TopicTitle: [chart] Who's Visiting Whom? ---- solar system exploration graph

Articles.Content:
http://www.chartgeek.com/solar-system-exploration/

I found this very cool.

Great graphic, but some corrections: Chang'e 2 is no longer orbiting the moon; it's transiting into deep space after vising the Earth-Sun L2 and flying by the asteroid Toutatis. Also ARTEMIS P1 and P2 orbited the Earth-Moon L1 and L2 points for awhile, but are now in lunar orbit.
I'm honestly surprised Russia doesn't have a flag anywhere.

I'm honestly surprised Russia doesn't have a flag anywhere.

Seconded, especially given they started out as the front runners in interplanetary exploration.

The last partially successful russian interplanetary mission was phobos-2 in '88. Everything program since then has experienced massive issues, and all the ones that have reached launch have failed. It's gotten to the point where India pulled out off a collaborative lunar lander project because they'd have a better chance of success if they did the whole thing themselves, despite the massive difference in experience.

Hahaha we got a random asteroid and you got stuck with MARS hahahah...

Oh wait, that's a better deal

DAMN BRITSH SPACE AGENCY
I do like it, but... is it just me or is the font a bit wonky?
